bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 21, 1915

div1.p: Blue requests feedback on newspaper article describing the use of bats as an anti-mosquito tool.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 21, 1915
div1.opener:
KFA
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 21, 1915.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
United States Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
I am inclosing herewith a letter received
from Dr. Chas. A. R. Campbell of San Antonio,
Texas, together with a page from the Houston
Chronicle telling about the erection of bat
roosts as an anti-mosquito measure. I shall
be glad to know what you think of the scheme.

Kindly return the letter and newspaper
page with your reply.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. jnj
Inclosures.
